title: Four shot, one dead in Pittsburgh's Fairywood neighborhood
content:
A 19-year-old man shot and killed Saturday night in Pittsburgh's Fairywood neighborhood has been identified.
The Allegheny County Medical Examiner's office said Kason Barnes, who was shot in the head, was killed in the 400 block of West Prospect Avenue about 10 p.m.
Three other people were shot, as well, as they played dice in the street, police said.
A 22-year-old man from Fairywood had a minor gunshot wound to the hand, police said. A 20-year-old Hill District man was shot in the legs and side, while a man from Sheraden was taken to Ohio Valley General Hospital privately — and later transferred to Allegheny General Hospital — for a minor gunshot wound to the leg.
All surviving victims are currently in stable condition, police said.
Investigators said the men were outside playing dice when a gold minivan and silver car drove northbound down the street. At least two people exited the vehicles and fired multiple shots at the victims, police said.
According to state court records, Mr. Barnes was charged with carrying a firearm without a license and possession with intent to deliver stemming from an arrest March 2, 2014.
He was released on bail a day later. Mr. Barnes was scheduled for a nonjury trial before Common Pleas Judge Joseph K. Williams III on Sept. 9.
